headlines.title: See photos of a Swiss glacier melting in the heat of climate change
headlines.description: RHONE GLACIER, Switzerland (AP) — Drip, drip. Trickle, trickle. That's the sound of water seeping from a sunbaked and slushy Swiss glacier that geoscientists are monitoring for signs of continued retreat by the majestic masses of ice under the heat of global warming.

headlines.title: Heat waves are getting more dangerous with climate change - and we may still be underestimating them
headlines.description: The intensifying and expansive heat wave affecting around 150 million people in the United States from Wisconsin to Washington, DC, bears the hallmarks of human-caused global warming.

headlines.title: Humans to hit critical climate threshold by 2028, study says
headlines.description: A team of 60 international scientists report that by early 2028 society will have emitted enough greenhouse gases that the Earth will be pretty much locked into hitting the internationally agreed upon preferred limit for global warming.

headlines.title: Climate Crisis 'Evil Twin' Is Coming for Marine Life
headlines.description: "It is a line between functional and failing ecosystems."

headlines.title: Destruction of Swiss village highlights the dangers as the world's glaciers melt
headlines.description: The landslide that buried a Swiss village and riverbed is refocusing attention on the role of global warming in glacier collapses around the world.

headlines.title: SC Supreme Court hears key gerrymandering case
headlines.description: South Carolina's Supreme Court reviews a case on the 2022 congressional map. Plaintiffs claim gerrymandering violates voters' rights, seeking new district lines.

headlines.title: Consultant acquitted of AI robocall voter suppression charges
headlines.description: A political consultant who sent robocalls that used artificial intelligence to mimic former President Joe Biden has been acquitted of 22 criminal charges in New Hampshire.

headlines.title: Federal judge blocks Trump executive order that requires proof of US citizenship to vote and limits mail-in ballots
headlines.description: A federal judge in Massachusetts on Friday blocked part of President Donald Trump’s executive order that seeks to revamp how elections are run in the United States.

headlines.title: Tarrant County redistricting proposal is bad government
headlines.description: Partisan gerrymandering happens on both sides of the aisle. But it can easily go too far, and when it does, it undermines fair representation, selectively...

headlines.title: Ruling in North Dakota case erases path for people in 7 states to sue under the Voting Rights Act
headlines.description: Private citizens in seven states no longer have a legal path to sue under a key section of the Voting Rights Act, under a federal appeals court ruling.

headlines.title: Kennedy names new members of CDC vaccine advisory panel days after removing previous advisers
headlines.description: Just two days after retiring the entirety of the US Centers for Disease Control and Prevention’s vaccine advisory panel, US Health and Human Services Secretary Robert F. Kennedy Jr. has appointed several prominent critics of the government’s Covid-19 response to that committee.

headlines.title: Disney Lorcana Reveals First Look At New Frozen-Inspired Gift Set & Fabled Accessories
headlines.description: An Elsa Gift Box is coming to Disney Lorcana in October, as well as the anticipated Fabled set and boosters, and a lot of accessories to go with it.

headlines.title: Match Masters free gifts, coins, and boosters links (May 2025)
headlines.description: Nothing beats free gifts, coins, and boosters.

headlines.title: Democrats Who Championed Biden’s Re-election Bid Now Seek Atonement
headlines.description: With their party facing record low approval ratings, many top Democrats are trying to reposition themselves from Biden boosters to truth-tellers of what really happened in 2024.

headlines.title: FDA picks critic of COVID boosters to be new top vaccines official
headlines.description: Dr. Vinay Prasad replaces Dr. Peter Marks, who Prasad had called "dangerous."

headlines.title: The father of a man shot during latest protests in Kenya calls for police accountability
headlines.description: Activists and the father of a Kenyan civilian who was shot at close range by police during protests over the alleged killing of a blogger in custody are demanding accountability.

headlines.title: B.C. attorney general pushes for bail reform for repeat offenders
headlines.description: Niki Sharma outlined proposed changes in a letter to her federal counterpart, Sean Fraser

headlines.title: NYPD chief suing NYC politician who bit him at protest
headlines.description: An NYPD chief is still suing the NYC councilwoman accused of taking a bite out of his arm at a protest despite a "restorative justice" meeting between the two, The Post has learned.

headlines.title: Brooklyn DA drops charges against Council Member Susan Zhuang who bit NYPD chief — instead opts for ‘restorative justice’
headlines.description: Brooklyn Council member Susan Zhuang will not face charges for biting an NYPD chief after she completed a "restorative justice" program, according to the Brooklyn District Attorney's Office.

headlines.title: Andrew Cuomo defends record, offers no apology for controversial COVID policies in Post interview
headlines.description: Ex-Governor Andrew Cuomo defended his lengthy record -- deflecting responsibility and refusing to admit any mistakes for his most controversial decisions such as the deadly COVID-19 pandemic and bail reform as he mounts a comeback bid for New York City mayor.

headlines.title: 75 million deepfakes blocked: Persona leads the corporate fight against hiring fraud
headlines.description: Persona blocks 75 million fake job candidates as AI hiring fraud explodes across corporate America, forcing companies to deploy advanced identity verification tools to combat deepfake infiltration.

headlines.title: Meta sues maker of explicit deepfake app for dodging its rules to advertise AI ‘nudifying’ tech
headlines.description: Meta is suing the Hong Kong-based maker of the app CrushAI, a platform capable of creating sexually explicit deepfakes, claiming that it repeatedly circumvented the social media company’s rules to purchase ads.

headlines.description: The singer warned of the impact on the industry if the use of unauthorized digital replicas goes unchecked.

headlines.title: Trump signs bill cracking down on explicit deepfakes
headlines.description: The bipartisan "Take it Down Act" passed both chambers overwhelmingly and is one of the few pieces of legislation Trump has signed into law in his second term.

headlines.title: Providence households to receive mailer for dealing with ICE
headlines.description: The mailer is “in direct response to the brutal and unconstitutional enforcement tactics currently being undertaken by the far-right federal administration,” officials said.

headlines.title: Tucker Carlson sarcastically floats nuking Iran if they actually try killing Trump in fiery clash with Ted Cruz over Israel conflict
headlines.description: Right-wing pundit Tucker Carlson suggested that the US should contemplate nuking Iran if allegations are true that the theocratic regime has been conspiring to assassinate President Trump, during a fiery two-hour debate with Sen. Ted Cruz.
headlines.explanation: The headline suggests that floating the idea of nuking Iran could lead to extreme and catastrophic consequences without sufficient evidence, implying a chain of events that may not necessarily follow from the initial statement.

headlines.title: Tucker Carlson, Ted Cruz Clash Over Israel's Meaning In Bible
headlines.description: The right-wing pundit's clash with the senator comes as Republicans debate whether or not to dig deeper into conflict in the Middle East.

headlines.title: How accused Minnesota assassin Vance Boelter transitioned from popular local athlete to radical far-right Christian
headlines.description: Accused Minnesota assassin Vance Boelter was a popular high-school athlete before becoming born again in his teens, moving into a tent in the park to preach and eventually morphing into an apparent far-right Christian.

headlines.title: Alex Jones accused of shielding more than $5 million in assets
headlines.description: The trustee overseeing Jones' personal bankruptcy case is accusing the far-right conspiracy theorist of trying to shield more than $5 million.

headlines.title: New CDC vaccine advisers discuss COVID-19, RSV shots
headlines.description: U.S. Health Secretary Robert F. Kennedy Jr.’s new vaccine advisory panel plans to revisit long-settled questions about childhood vaccines.

headlines.title: Dallas-area family pleads guilty to fraud in pandemic-era Paycheck Protection Program
headlines.description: Seven members of a North Texas family stole tens of thousands of dollars from a federal COVID-19 program.

headlines.title: Louisiana Workforce Commission employee pleads guilty to wire fraud, defrauding state for $200,000
headlines.description: A former Louisiana Workforce Commission employee pled guilty to wire fraud after using emergency financial assistance enacted during the COVID-19 pandemic to defraud the state of $200,000.

headlines.title: HIV: Supercharged Vaccine Could Protect Well With Just One Dose
headlines.description: The approach employed by the research team could be used against other diseases—including COVID-19 and influenza.

headlines.title: Israeli strikes kill dozens in Gaza as Trump says ceasefire possible "next week"
headlines.description: The strikes come as President Trump on Friday said there could be a ceasefire agreement between Israel and Hamas within the next week.
